comment.author: 56911765@N04
comment._content: Love it. I was a child when they stopped using the line and tore it up before the main line electrification upgrade for the DART. My parents would buy chips and take us down to watch the Ferry come in, The Sealink St. David I think.

comment.author: 42733023@N07
comment._content: When was the Engine built? Where? How did it get there?

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Just rediscovered this image, all the more interesting now that the pier buildings have been demolished! Although it looks like engine 99, it's No.199 Lough Neagh, a U Class Great Northern 4-4-0 locomotive of 1947, which at the time were a novelty to be seen south of Amiens St (Connolly), with half of the of the dissolved Great Northern Railway stock having only passed to CIE's books the previous year.
